01: A collection of essential cocktail recipes.

0001: A clear spirit composed of water and ethanol.
0002: A clear spirit made from juniper berries.
0003: A distilled spirit made from fermented grain mash.
0004: A type of American whiskey, primarily made from corn.
0005: A distilled spirit made from sugarcane byproducts.
0006: A milder variety of rum that is typically clear.
0007: A medium-bodied rum that has been aged for a few years.
0008: A rich and full-bodied rum aged longer and often with caramel added.
0009: A Brazilian spirit made from fermented sugarcane juice.
0010: A Mexican spirit made from the blue agave plant.

0020: A high-proof spirit infused with botanicals including anise and wormwood.

Heat up the coconut cream and sugar until the sugar is disolved. Let it cool and store in a siphon over night.
Shake the rest of the ingredients and strain into a chilled glass with ice.
Top with the coconut foam and a basil leaf.

Tim Durand on Pexels

Thai Basil is a very famous cocktail from Asian Post Office in Stockholm.
This recipe is not the original secret recipe, it is a result of trial and error from Drinkoteket. The result is a cocktail where both the drink and the foam is almost identical to what you would get at Asian Post Office!

00080:
Heat milk and cream with spices, take off when it starts boiling.
Whisk eggs yolks and sugar, then slowly add hot milk mixture.
Cook until thickened (around 72-75°C). Then add bourbon and let it cool before bottling it. Leave the spices in for more flavor.
Serve chilled.
The egg whites can be whipped and carefully added to the mixture after it has cooled down.

A Collins can be made with a variety of spirits:

Old Tom Gin - Tom Collins
Genever or London Dry Gin - John Collins
Scotch or Applejack - Jack Collins
Cognac - Pierre Collins
Rum - Pedro Collins
Irish Whiskey - Mike Collins
Bourbon - Colonel Collins
Canadian Whiskey - Captain Collins
Vodka - Joe Collins
Tequila - Pepito Collins

Shake everything except the soda and strain into a glass with ice.
Top up with soda and serve.
00148: Pour everything into a glass with ice and stir.
00149: Mix everything with ice until half-frozen consistency and pour into a glass.
00150:
Stir everything in a mixing glass until chilled.
Strain into a chilled glass and serve.
